WASHINGTON : The United States on Monday charged five serving Chinese military officials with stealing American technology and trade secrets in sectors such as nuclear power and solar energy through cyber - espionage and hacking .

The unprecedented case , which has erupted in the form of a Justice Department indictment unsealed in a US District Court , opens a new front in the diplomatic and economic fracas between Washington and Beijing , who yet happen to be the world largest trading partners .
In releasing the indictment , US Attorney General Eric Holder and other law enforcement officials said they were putting a human face on the impact of Chinese cybercrimes and computer hacking .
